ygData.msgSnippet: (OOC: I hope everything works out with your grandmother, Carnage. Take all the time you need replying.) Tavatron snarled softly to herself. Why did she care

(OOC: I hope everything works out with your grandmother, Carnage. Take all 
the time you need replying.)

Tavatron snarled softly to herself. Why did she care what happened to him? 
He was just one of hundreds of 'bots she had known over the years, what made 
him so... so... different? She sighed inwardly, now was neither the time nor 
the place to contemplate her feelings. She had to strain her ears to hear 
him draw his breath. When most 'bots would be breathing quite heavily his 
breaths were low and shallow.

Tavatron watched as he fell after his first attempt to rise, her own concern 
growing, but not nearly as evident as before. She wanted to reach out and 
help him, but held back, he had to do this on his own. Besides, there wasn't 
a single part of his body that she could touch without causing immense pain 
of some kind.

Tavatron held her breath as she waited for Dinobot to attempt to stand 
again, and fail. She was worried, but why?! Why in the inferno did she care 
what happened to him? She had always been a loner, rarely making, much less 
being able to keep friends. Tavatron breathed a sigh of relief when Dinobot 
stood, her concern finally subsiding. She stepped back as his repair system 
took care of some of his more... prominant damage, hopefully making walking 
a little easier.

Tavatron walked over to him and placed his hand on her shoulder, indicating 
that he should use her for support:

"You know, you've got to stop saving me like this, you're going to get your 
self killed one of these days."

Tavatron smiled up at him, she was joking of course, but was obviously 
relived that he was able to stand.
